subject: Non-acceptance of certified cheques as instrument of accepting the bid security-reg.
text: HTrfm 77414 TTHT wifaqrv THq Phane : 91-11-25074100/25074200 (i 4T6T, Tg 4aat 3 Ri4 TATTT4) 44H / Fax 91-11-260935Q7 25093514 National Highways Authority of India WA, Extn;; 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Shipping; Road Transport and Highways) #-5W 6, 0727-10, ETt7 7 faxi-1t0 075 6-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 No 11041/217/2007-Admn 4th January 2007 POLICY MATTERS ADMINISTRATIONIFINANCE 02/2007) Decision taken on Finance Division File No. NHAIF&AIPoticy BGr2004/210/11/1 Sub: Non-acceptance of Certified Cheques as instrument of accepting the bid security-reg As per clause 4.14.2 of NHAI Works Manual, 2008 the bid security shall be in favour of National Highways Authority of Indla and may be in one of the following forms: Deposit-at-call Receipt from any scheduled Indian Bank or a foreign Bank located in India and approved by the Reserve Bank of India (RBIF Fixed Deposit Receipt; certified cheques or an irrevocable letter of credit; issued by scheduled Indian Bank Or & foreign bank approved by the Reserve Bank of India Bank Guarantees issued by the authorized bank 2 The position of admissibility of "certified cheques" as a valid instrument for accepting the bid security has been examined and it is found that the banks do not have a system of issuing such certified cheques. in view of this, it is clarified that the certified chequer is not acceptable fom of instrument for accepting the bid security in NHAI. Accordingly, the clause 4.14.2 (b} of NHAI Works Manual is modified to read as under (b) Fixed Deposit Receipt, or an irrevocable letter of credit; issued by any scheduled Indian Bank or foreign bank approved by the Reserve Bank of India This Issues with the approval of Chairman, NHAI.
